text:
Greg Foot: Hey guys so this is the twelfth
and final explanation video for the 12 Explosions
of Christmas.

I'm Greg -
Mike Sansom: and I'm Mike!

Greg: and I really hope you've enjoyed these
so far.
Right now we are utterly freezing in a field.
It's been an awesome day.
Mike: It's been amazing, absolutely amazing.

Greg: So number twelve is an epic firework
Christmas tree!
Yes!

And here it is and you can see it, all silvery
and covered in foil.

So each of these here, these white sticks,
is a lance and on top is a little bit of gun
powder.

You ignite the gun powder at the top, it burns
down and it gives you a coloured flare, in
the shape of a Christmas tree.

Mike: That's right and like we saw with the
Christmas puddings, a different metal salt

creates different colours and this one hopefully
will be green -- so barium salts.

Greg: Oh and we put some red ones, some strontium
ones, right down the bottom for the stump
at the bottom of the tree.

If you have seen, and I hope you very much
have by now, our whole 12 Explosions of Christmas

video, you'll see there's a little cheeky
finale as well around this tree.
You're the pyrotechnician, tell us about them!

Mike: so we've got some shells that are going
to be bursting above us.

The shells are three inch, so they're quite
small ones, but they've got a lot of punch,
they've got a lot of powder inside.

So they're going to be propelled up into the
sky like a cannon, and they're going to go

up to about 75 to 100 metres, and explode
with a massive explosion and loads of colours.

Greg: So it's a full electronic firing system
again.

The first cue is gonna do the tree, so it's
gonna do the flares, then the second one is

gonna do the gerbs at the top of there, and
then the third one is gonna fire the three
inch shells back there!
Should be the perfect finale!

We are very cold so we're going to get going,
we always have to say don't try this at home.

We really hope you guys enjoyed it, have a
very Merry Christmas!

Greg: That is the 
right finale for the twelve explosions of
Christmas!

I hope you guys have enjoyed it, I hope you
have a great Christmas!
